entry.title: Web Design for the Completely Clueless
entry.content:
Larry Buchanan volunteered 3 hours of his time today and talked to us about design.

The design process is a complete mystery to someone who hasn’t studied design before, namely me. Larry highlighted some key design principles and walked us through his design process using an example. Thank you Larry.

A few of my takeaways:

  • Sketch first, code later. Thinking about design while coding is actually slower than if we sketched first and turn it into code later

  • Color

    • RGB is for web and CMYK is for print. When using design software such as Adobe Illustrator and Indesign, always remember to switch to RGB when we want to deploy to the web

    • To start: use black, white, and one other color. Dark gray works well to bring uout the sophistication feel of the site as pure black tend to overwhelm

  • Typography

    • Serif and Sans Serif, try one of each to bring out contrast

    • Consistency builds street cred

  • Layout

    • Make something dominant

    • Use the Grid system like Skeleton to help make sites responsive

Helpful Sites:

wireframes - https://wireframe.cc/

beautiful sites to look at for inspirations - http://www.siteinspire.com/

skeleton - http://getskeleton.com/

flat ui colors - http://flatuicolors.com/

color wheel - https://color.adobe.com/create/color-wheel/

more colors - http://www.colourlovers.com/

Design News - https://news.layervault.com/

entry.title: Deploying Octopress Blog to Github Pages
entry.content:
This blog is powered by Octopress. There were a few issues I ran into while trying to deploy my blog to github pages, the first was the following:

## Pushing generated _deploy website
To git@github.com:carriexu/carriexu.github.io.git
! [rejected]        master -> master (non-fast-forward)
error: failed to push some refs to 'git@github.com:carriexu/carriexu.github.io.git'

Thanks to this stackoverflow post I found, I learned that it was failing to deploy to github pages when I ran rake deploy because git was not able to recognize which branch to deploy.

To resolve this issue, I had to make a little change in the :push task in the Rakefile. I changed this line Bundler.with_clean_env { system "git pull" } to Bundler.with_clean_env { system "git pull origin #{deploy_branch}" }

Once that is changed, I ran rake deploy again and it worked.

The second issue appeared after I tried to add a new landing page and moved my blogs to /blog, by following this tutorial, I was able to add a new home tab and direct the initial landing to there, however, my newly added /blog page were no longer displaying the blog posts, instead it looked more like the blog archive page.

After digging around for a bit, I found this stackoverflow post, which was exactly my issue. To resolve it, I went into _config.yml, and changed paginate_path: "posts/:num" to paginate_path: "blog/posts/:num"

This resolved the issue and my posts are once again displaying properly. Hurray!

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content: Hello and welcome, my name is Carrie. I am a junior full-stack web developer, this is my learning journey.Thank you for reading.
